 Step (Lv.2) 01.01. Account View Step (Lv.3) 01.01.02 View detailed account information
 
 Menu Account (General Information) 
 
 Navigation CRM App > Account > Account List > Account Details View 
 
 1. Account Information Section 
 4 -This section contains the most basic and
 essential information about the account.
 -Most fields in this section are mandatory.
 1 
 
 2. Description Section 
 -This area displays a text-based description
 of the company. 
 
 
 3. SAP I/F Information 
 -Shows data retrieved from the SAP system
 during integration. 
 -This information is read-only and cannot be
 2 
 edited in Salesforce. 
 
 4. NiceD&B Information Tab 
 3 -When clicked, this tab displays company
 data integrated from NiceD&B. 
 
 -Users can view a company overview and
 financial information for the past three years.
 -This information is also read-only and
 cannot be modified.

 -Shows meeting note title, key account

 created it, and summary information.
 2 -Clicking the “New” button allows you to

 3. Meeting Gift History List 
 -Displays the list of “Meeting Gift History”
 recorded in the connected meeting notes.
 -Shows recipient, gift name, and meeting
 date. 
 
 4. Clicking the ‘My Organization’ Tab
 3 -Filters content based on the organization of

Step 01. Account Management 
 
 
 Step (Lv.2) 01.02. Account Update Step (Lv.3) 01.02.01 Update account information(1/2)
 
 Menu Account 
 
 Navigation CRM App > Account > Account List > Account Details View 
 
 1. Click “Edit” Button 
 -Opens a popup that allows editing of the
 account. 
 -Only editable data fields can be modified.
 1 3 
 (* Fields like basic information can also be
 edited by clicking the pencil icon.)
 
 2. After Filling Out the Edit Popup, Click
 “Save” 
 -Upon saving, the account information is
 updated. 
 -Duplicate checks are performed during
 editing as well 
 (e.g., when modifying business registration
 number or VAT ID). 
 
 3. Organization Chart Setup for the Account
 -Not a mandatory section; can be configured
 if needed. 
 -Clicking the organization chart opens the
 setup screen. 
 -Detailed organization chart settings are
 2 
 available.

Step 01. Account Management 
 
 
 Step (Lv.2) 01.02. Account Update Step (Lv.3) 01.02.01 Update account information(2/2)
 
 Menu Account 
 
 Navigation CRM App > Account > Account List > Account Details View 
 
 1. Click “Manage Department” Button
 -Opens a popup where responsible 
 Departments can be added or removed.
 -This button is only visible to the owner of
 1 
 the account and its responsible 
 Departments. 
 2. After Selecting a Department, Click the
 Right Arrow 
 -Adds the selected Department (from the
 left) as a responsible Department for the
 3 
 account. 
 -The added Department gains editing
 permissions. 
 -By default, group-level Departments can be
 added, and direct groups/sections under the
 2 division or department can also be added.
 3. Clicking the Delete Icon 
 -Removes the selected Department from the
 editable list. 
 
 4. Clicking “Save” 
 -Applies the changes made to the 
 responsible Department settings. 
 4

 Menu Account (2/3) 
 
 Navigation CRM App > Account > Account List > New Create Pop-up 
 
 1. Select Country Classification 
 -Choose between Domestic or Overseas
 -Domestic: Business Registration Number
 is required 
 -Overseas: VAT ID is required 
 (DUNS Number is provided as an optional)
 2. Select Country Type 
 -For Domestic, South Korea is 
 1 3 automatically set 
 -For Overseas, search and select the
 country manually 
 2 4

 -Choose one of the following: Account,
 Partner, or Government Relations 
 -If Account is selected, additional selection
 of Account Type is required 
 4. Select Account Type 
 -Choose one: Customer, Vendor, or Both
 -If Customer is selected, Tax Type
 selection is required
